titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Walter C. Rivers Transcribed Letters on Walt Whitman's Homosexuality, 1946 RL.11282
titlestmt.author: Alice L. Poffinberger

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-08-30 09:24:27 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Walter C. Rivers transcribed letters on Walt Whitman's homosexuality
did.abstract: W. C. Rivers was a Walt Whitman scholar. Collection comprises a file of correspondence addressed to Walter C. Rivers on the subject of Whitman's homosexuality. Includes transcriptions of letters from Bliss Perry and other contemporary Whitman scholars, as well as specialists on the subject of homosexuality, including Havelock Ellis.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: W. C. Rivers was a Walt Whitman scholar.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Walter C. Rivers Transcribed Letters on Walt Whitman's Homosexuality were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a transfer in 1946.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Walter C. Rivers Transcribed Letters on Walt Whitman's Homosexuality, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises a file of correspondence addressed to Walter C. Rivers on the subject of Whitman's homosexuality. Includes transcriptions of letters from Bliss Perry and other contemporary Whitman scholars, as well as specialists on the subject of homosexuality, including Havelock Ellis.
